review_body: Nice hotel in good location for south street seaport and financial district Rooms large and clean but a little bareBed comfortable Good buffet breakfast with hot and cold itemsFor the price in nyc a good deal

THIS IS NOT A FOUR STAR HOTEL. if this place represented itself as a three star hotel, people would know what they are getting and would be satisfied. but calling it 4 stars and delivering 3 is disappointing. needs updates, but decent sized spaces. a solid 3.

My wife and I stayed here for five nights in October. It’s a good hotel in a great location, a world away from the noise and mess of mid and north Manhattan, with some good bars and restaurants close by.The best thing about the hotel, however, are the staff. All of them we’re incredibly polite and helpful, but I do have to single out one person in particular for praise. I believe the lady’s name was Michel. My wife and I cannot thank her enough for her help. When our pre-booked ride to the airport failed to turn up she got straight on the phone and took no nonsense from the person on the other end, who was insistent that the car had been parked outside for 45 minutes - it had actually gone to the wrong hotel.She even took the license plate number and went outside to flag the car down. To the manager/owner of the hotel, make sure you keep hold of your current employees, particularly Michel. Staff like her are worth their weight in gold to your business.

Check-In/Check-OutChecking in and out was smooth. The gentleman who took care of us was friendly.The RoomWe got the room with the living room, not sure if this is the standard room here but I don't think so. There's also a small kitchen with a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and sink. The floor was a bit cracked in the kitchen. There are windows in the bedroom, a small tv but the remote controller was not working and the tv was not working as well. The bed was a decent size for two but somehow we found a few bugs on the bed, not bed bugs coz we didn't experience any for the two nights we stayed here.The BathroomThe bathroom was a decent size. There's a bathtub but wouldn't recommend to use them looks dirty with stain probably because is old. The water pressure could use some more. There is a hairdryer.Restaurant/EntertainmentThere is a restaurant since they offer a breakfast buffet in the morning but we didn't try them since it's New York! gotta do the local stuff!Hotel Service/AmenitiesThey have free wifi in the room but the wifi was very slow. They also do baggage service.OverallNot sure would come back here again to stay. The hotel is doing partly renovation when we were there not sure if they're doing renovation for the whole hotel or just some part of the hotel. But they really do need to upgrade and do some fixing on their property especially the rooms. Definitely not for the elderly.

we enjoyed a wonderful warm stay in NYC downtown and I will surely recommend this place to all....very close to the battery park and one world observatory :) if u enjoy walking and live like a new yorker 129, front street is the place !!!a big thank u to the warm JORGE and NELSON soooo helpful and wonderful staff.... :)

review_body: I stayed at Eurostars when I had a training meeting next door at the Microtek building. The price of the hotel was great and I got upgraded to a suite. The location was amazing. Close to everything in the financial district. Friendly courteous checkin and helpful staff. Highly recommended boutique hotel.

False advertisement.. Therr is no bar or gym. Purchased a queen size bed ... It was a full size bed. There was blood stains and dirt on my comforter. When I asked for it to be removed, 20 minutes later the Concierge "Ray" told me he needed gloves to remove the comforter that I took off of me with my bare hands.

I've stayed in nicer hotels, and, frankly, so have you. But, you (like me) booked it on Hotwire; thus, there's no turning back now, so you might as well enjoy it.The rooms were fine and at one time nice, but they've been well lived in and the attempts at fixing what small cosmetic issues they have, are rather lacklustre. The hotel has a lot of potential were the owners to throw some money at it, and I think the 3.5 star rating is not wildly inaccurate, but about a half a star too many.It is an average hotel in an average location, but it has a really good price. You're saving money on the resort fees that all other NYC hotels charge you and, let's be honest, you chose it because of the price, so there's not much to complain about.The bed was comfy and the pillows nice, and I was pleasantly surprised by both the size of my room, and its solitude from the street below. Overall, I was neither displeased, nor blown away, and for a hotel at this price point, I think that's a very honourable delivery. Don't go in with high expectations, but don't be worried either. It's an average place and you're an average person, so just put your ego aside and accept what you paid for; you might just find (like I did) that you like the place for all its little quirks. They all seem fitting.

The hotel is old and a bit run down BUT the rooms are super nice and super large ! The location is good for water transportation but very far from the main attractions like Central Park and museums... a taxi will run you $20 1way!

Only one night stay. The hotel was located near Wall st at financial district. The area around the hotel is not shopping and restaurant area, but it is located near Battery park, place where we will start the Liberty statue and island cruise from NY.

I was very happy with our weekend stay here. I booked a room with a queen size bed and they put us in a suite which was great when my son slept a little later. Breakfast was included - breads, meats, cheeses, cereal, fruit, coffee, eggs, bacon/sausage. Staff were amiable and helpful. Room was clean, bed and pillows comfortable, nice location - amenities available but not too busy. This hotel was less than Pod 51 or another budget hotel and it was great.

We chose to stay near the water in the Financial District since we wanted to visit the 9/11 Museum, the new World Trade Center and have dinner in the Little Italy. You have a parking across the street with a reasonable pricing. The location is great and you can go for a walk on the pier which is 2 streets away from the hotel. No need for a transportation if you stay around the Financial District, including Chinatown and Little Italy. Breakfast was not included (the buffet was expensive).

My family enjoyed our stay at the Eurostar Wall Street. The area was nice and the room had 2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa(twin size). Breakfast was well worth the cost and we felt the room was a good value. I liked the location except the distance to the subway but that was the only negative.

Perhaps my best hotel experience in New York so far. It was our first stay in the Financial district of Big apple after having tested the midtown and Times Square area 3 times. The hotel is in a great and calm area close to several nice places (Wall street, Battery park, Pier 17 …) and to various transportation means (Subway, boats, …). The hotel is of a human dimension which is rare in NY. Only 6 floors and 10-12 rooms by floor. The staff was extremely kind and helpful with a special thanks to Jorge who has always taken very good care of us regardless it was related to door keys not working, finding a restaurant or taking care of our luggage’s. The rooms are very large, very well furbished and daily cleaning was just outstanding. The bedding is of high quality which is very important for us given our age and related comfort requirements. We also tested once the breakfast offer and we were very positively surprised of the quality and diversity of the food. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will very likely consider it for our next stay in NY. The price for value is good taking into account you are on Manhattan island after all but much much more reasonable that midtown offer versus the comfort you get and rooms size.

Best thing about this hotel are the very friendly and helpful staff! Excellent breakfast as well. Very clean facilities. Location is very good too, convenient to the Financial District and with easy access to the Subway. Quiet. Rooms are large, although split-level may be an issue for some guests. Most sections of the building, including reception and our room, are in need of a renovation. Although most things are in working order (not so the disabled lift in reception!!), one can feel that this hotel has seen better days. We did not like that we had to climb a short stairs to reach reception, dragging our luggage along (reception staff do help when they are not busy with another guest). We also did not like the split levels within our guestroom, but understand that the architecture of this period building may limit what can be done... Lastly, with such large bedrooms, why not have king-sized beds instead of double beds?

we got upgraded to a one bedroom suite it was huge! and they gave plenty of shampoo and soap when asked and let us check our bags a bit longer after checkout to check out the city.i lost my necklace here as well, one i just had from a church with holy water, and the lady at the concierge michele was super nice and found it. also shout out to jorge who upgraded us, if he had not i wouldve not been so happy! he was wonderful! great place! coming back again!

The metro station is only a short walk. The hotel reception is quite small but the staff were polite and helpful. The rooms were a good size and the beds comfortable. There is also a reasonable sized workstation / desk. The bathroom could be improved upon but overall the hotel was decent value for money.

Clean and quiet. Very old building but rooms were very clean. Our air conditioner was incredibly loud that we could not use it. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Close to a few touristy attractions such as the bull statue, Statue of Liberty, a museum and more.

My husband and I booked for parade day back in December to have a suite that our adult daughter could meet us at and spend night with us. I booked direct thru site requested early check-in if possible. Called again two weeks before and requested same and made sure sofabed would be made up for daughter. Called again on train ride in to City at 1030am. Was told room should be ready by about 130. (3pm regular checkin) Great...we got there at 1255 and same clerk told us would be ready very soon he could hold our bags. So...rather than go uptown to parade immediately we checked bags in and went down the street for lunch. Came back to hotel at 205 to freshen up and head to parade. We could tell as soon as we walked in the clerk forgot about us bc he didn't look up or make any eye contact. At that point we were afraid that if we left that we would return to wrong room type etc. So we then spent another hour waiting for our "early check-in" in a lobby. We finally were checked in by clerk who took over for him...at 3:15. If he had just told us no early check-in we would have dropped our stuff and headed uptown. We missed the whole parade and our catacombs tour because of this. Months of plans and wasted money. The room was very nice, spacious. Suited 3 of us well...finally. We would normally have highly recommended if not for this poor customer service.

I recently stayed 5 nights in the Eurostar Wall St. just returned home today after a memorable trip. I have to say I just loved the hotel. From arrival to departure all of the staff were both friendly and professional. Meeting and greeting guests with a smile and chatting I recognised individuals who for once actually enjoyed their job and role.I have traveled a lot through the years and in some places on observation staff really can come across as uncaring and lack lustre.This was not the case here they were welcoming from morning to night - so thanks to you all for making us feel at home. So first the area itself lower Manhattan the Financial District I have stayed in this area in the past and we like it. Lots of bars restaurants and local supermarkets nearby. South St Seaport is a 4 Minute walk so it’s quaint cobblestone Streets with bars restaurants and original coffee/bistros.You can also go right down to the prominade where you will find the East River ferry a commuter ferry that costs $2.75 and you can take it to various destinations including Williamsburg.Lovely views we had some fabulous nighttime pictures of the Brooklyn The hotel itselfNo traffic noise at all. We were in a lovely suite And really it was like an apartment massive rooms high ceilings with a separate kitchen.I really value space and we got it here. The living room had 4 big windows with black out curtains.Very clean I would not be looking for another hotel I would be booking here in the future I will attach some pictures so thanks again for your kind hospitality Eurostar.

When you are planning trip to NYC there is one big headache - accomodation.I have desperately searched for accomodation and even toyed with the hostels. One of these days, I have again surfed the Internet and found a hotel at Wall Street with a very reasanoble price - Eurostrars Wall Street.I had my doubts, but I booked it anyway. When I have arrived the hotel was beyond any expectations. The room was big and included kitchen, guest room and bedroom. Guys at the reception were very friendly and knowledgable. The breakfast was also great - muffins, bacon, cereals, sausages, porridge, fresh fruits and nice coffee (which is quite rare at the American hotels).Also, I should mention, that compared to Broadway and Times Square, Wall Street is a very quite street, so you would get a nice sleep.So, if you are planning to visit NYC, book a room at Eurostars Wall Street. I have only one wish - that they would add Netflix, because it is a perfect thing to fight jet lag.

We had a lovely stay here, the hotel is clean and our room was a suite (we had just booked a standard room) which had a kitchen, living area, bathroom and double bed - very impressed. The hotel is situated right next to the Brooklyn bridge and a short walk from the New York Stock exchange and the 9/11 memorial. The hotel is around a 20 minute subway ride from Times Square - If you are going to get the subway here you can either get off at Wall Street or at Fulton Street. Would definitely recommend as it was great value for money and a comfortable stay.

So kind people, Jorge and the rest of the staff were incrediblely kind to us. Room was correct as well as the cleaning service, forniture, etc. Location was excellent. We recommend it to everybody who visit Lower Manhattan

Rooms are VERY outdated and the beds are very old. Stayed here 2 times for business and both times I had a bad experience. After getting out of the elevator it feels like you're in a very old building and even feels uncomfortable during night time.

The hotel lobby looks very modern and recently redecorated. The location is reasonably good. Just off Wall Street and a short walk to the subway stations nearby. The breakfast offers a good variety and is very cheap for a hotel of this class, al though the quality of the offered products could be better sometimes. The rooms are very spacious, especially for such a prime location. Although it would be better if a little bit more of that space was added to the bathroom since it’s quite small by comparison. My room (504) showed some early signs of wear and tear. But in the hallway, the blue tape indicated that they are already in the process of modernizing the fifth floor. A small issue with the room; the television is very small and the cable signal was very blurry. Also, the keycards demagnetize very easily. This also happened in the last hotel I was staying in in NY, so it could be an issue with the local supplier. Try not to store the card in you wallet or near your phone or other devices. Overal, I would recommend this hotel mostly for business trips to Wall Street who seek comfort for a reasonable price.

Stayed in the first couple of weeks in July in this hotel . Booked a family room, though actually it is an apartment. Comfortable double bed in the main room with a not so comfortable double sofa bed in the lounge. Has two TVs each in the main bedroom and in the lounge. Spacious kitchen with several appliances, unfortunately oven and hobs have been disconnected due to a gas leak while back I was told. I think it is the case with all apartments in the hotel. Still it has a working microwave, good sized fridge freezer and a toaster. No kettle available. AC was not working optimally, however this was during a heatwave in NY.Coffee make at the reception provides free coffee 24/7, which I have never encountered before. Breakfast is quite good.Excellent location away from the Times Square chaos. Metro station is few hundred yards away. Closer to restaurants. 9/11 memorial, Brooklyn Bridge and Battery park are within walking distances.Staff, both at the reception and dining area were excellent, which is perhaps the best asset of the hotel/

My two night visit was one of the more unusual stays I’ve ever had. As documented by others the lifts are antiquated, the laminate floors peeling and the bathroom units are tired and water damaged. The air conditioning unit was definitely the loudest I’ve ever heard! The airconditioning unit blows air behind the curtain meaning that the rest of the room stays warm while having a super cooled window behind the curtain, tying the curtain up resolved this issue! Fortunately jet lag was my friend so I could turn the fan speed down and sleep through the racket. The strangest event was when I rang reception for some room service. I rang them for some room service from the in-room menu. The member of staff literally grunted his way through my order saying no more than three words! Thirty minutes later there was a knock at the door and I opened it to see a tiny old man with a takeaway bag in his hand, instead of providing room service they had ordered a takeaway to be delivered - truly bizarre!On the upside, the room was very large for NY. The room was reasonable and the cost fairly low and the location was good for me near Wall Street.

Positives: The room and bathroom were substantially larger that the norm in NY. Location of the hotel was good and staff were friendly.Negatives: The room was very worn and was not in keeping with the pictures at all. This would not normally bother me but it is noteworthy for this hotel. Cleanliness was fine but flooring was coming up and the furniture was chipped and/severely dated. Definitely requires refurbishment as it does not align to the standards I would expect from a basic four star hotel.

First of all stay away because this place is a dump. google, hotels.com and booking.com rate this place 3.5 and above but I'm not sure how. The slow draining sink was dirty when we arrived the front desk made little effort to solve our issue. Cracked showers faucet. The hallway smells like an ashtray. There were no outlets near bed and some outlets were non-working. The laminate flooring is peeling away. The bathroom is dingy, cheap cabinet doors are chipped, peeling and hang off hinge when opened. Nightstand sconces did not work. When I complained the front desk ask if I wanted to see another room on same floor but that room was smaller and the sofa bed was open and on the floor.

I am a mother of 1 travelling with 2 younger sisters. My son is at home so I need a fridge to store my breast milk during my trip so I picked this type of rooms and was satisfied. The facility is great and the room, even a bit old at some spots, met my expectation. I enjoyed staying in this big room with sofa and mini bar very much. Also, the staff are very kind and let us store our luggage for a few more days after we checked out as we had to fly to a wedding in NC and came back to pick it up before flying from NYC to Bangkok.The location is superb, only a few blocks away from World Trade Center, Fulton Center, C21 and NYSE. The Charging Bull is just so close to the hotel as well. If you consider staying in the downtown Manhattan, this should be one of your great options.

Clean, comfortable and decent size room, with a nice private bathroom. Breakfast was available for a convenient charge, and it was excellent prepared and served by very nice staff.Perfect location, walking distance to restaurants and bars, groceries, and more.

review_body: We had a nice time staying at this hotel at the financial district area. The location is really a plus! It was near a lot of good restaurants, groceries, and bars. It was also walking distance to ground zero. My favourite thing about this place is their bathroom amenities, it reminds me of Ibiza. Their bathroom amenities is from Ibiza and Its one of my favourite brand.

We stayed here for 4 nights while participating at the 5 Boro bike ride. We requested the 8th top floor quadruple room, which was very spacious and has a nice high vaulted ceiling. Jason (front desk) was very friendly and helpful and we could store our 4 bikes in the laundry room.The hotel has some small issues, little bit squeaking elevator, not many amenities and slow bit noisy airconditioning. We love the character of older buildings and the prize was good for NYC. We did not book directly at the hotel and did not include breakfast. There are two coffee shops at the corner of Wall St. Location is great if you don't want to be in the real busy area and still close to Wall St, Battery Park, World trade Centre and to subway stops. A convenient Citi-bike station is in the front of the hotel.It is just a block away from the East River, with the pier 11 ferry's and view of the Brooklyn bridge. Enjoy and bring a coffee on top of the Hornblower cruises building deck, a very relaxing start of your day. We parked our car convenient at the nearby Water St. parking garage. We would stay here again.

I booked this hotel for 5 nights at US$1061.30. Total bill came to US$1237.40 when they added $12.65 per day for the breakfast they advertised as "included" and US$22.96 for "business advantages", which charge they did not explain. My next call will be to the NYC tourism bureau to complain about being ripped off like this. (I had to dash for the train and could not stay to dispute the bill.)

I was a little scared to stay here after reading the reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised. Our room felt like a little apartment. It had some minor wear and tear, but nothing major. Yes, you can hear noise from the outside, but your in New York City. Of course you are going to hear honking cars and people going about their day. It was an easy walk with luggage from the Staten Island Ferry. Also an easy walk to the Wall St Metro Station and the 9/11 Memorial. Staff was professional and friendly. Breakfast was good. We would stay here again.

Great location, the pics shown for this hotel must be very old, our room was very dated and in need of some refreshment. Aircon was so noisy we left it off and then we could hear all the street noise and people in adjoining rooms. Would not stay here again.

I am very very surprised by the good reviews. This place is awful. It's run down, falling apart, and depressing. I made a list of everything that I noticed and was grossed out by during the stay. Keep in mind I got to see two rooms, and both had the same issues.Fixtures coming out of wall. This means anything that is mounted to the wall, there were holes around it. The bathroom wall had holes in it. The bathroom in the other room also had holes.Floor coming up off ground in most areas. The floor was lifted a quarter to a half inch in places. This was occurring in both rooms.Most of the linens were stained. Our comforter had a large yellow stain on it. None of the phones in the rooms worked. The other room's phone also was not working.The desk was breaking and super wobbly in both rooms.They prominently display their kitchen in their ads, however the oven is not allowed to be used at all.The paint job is terrible. Unmatching paint colors. Spotty, terrible. It looks so tacky.The whole room needs a deep cleaning and general repairs. They need to replace all of their linens.None of the clocks we're set to the correct time. They were all random different times.They never replaced our empty tissues. The box only had 3 tissues to begin with.No extra blankets. We had to walk downstairs because the phone isn't working, then ask for all of these items.The light blocking curtains barely covered the window. The city lights heavily leaked through the sides, bottom, and top.The noise level is ridiculous. I could hear everything from the street, and everything from the hallway. The windows are technicallyTheir breakfast had a bunch of dirty plates. I asked the server if they were the clean plates. He said yes, but they were all pretty dirty.The food for breakfast is ok, the fruit selection is great. In all of the pictures of the breakfast they have waffles, but they do not have waffle makers and did not serve any waffles.It was such a disappointing and gross hotel that I cancelled the rest of my reservation and switched to a much better hotel.I will never make this mistake again.Don't stay here.

The first impression when you enter this hotel is not the greatest: a small lobby, rather dark, a narrow sitting place, two slow moving elevators. Rooms are also furnished in a simple way and look rather bare. Details though are up to modern standards: bath rooms are modern and tidy; TV sets are of a good quality, lights are ok. On the positive side, the location of this hotel is good if you wish to stay in the financial district (which is not one of the most attractive areas in the City). On the negative side, service is rather poor: one morning breakfast was not available; on another day there was bacon but no eggs (!), on another day they did not clean up my room; etc. Staff at the reception are kind and cooperative.

To start the first mistake was to trust Priceline. I had used them in the past and did for here. Then I saw reviews on TripAdvisor and started to worry.I’m writing this as I sit in the room. Solid location but no where near 3 stars let alone the Priceline 4 Star I was snagged into.Clean isn’t the description since around bed is clearly not clean - it’s a laminate floor and other than the bed room is empty. Like what you might think a hotel in the old Soviet Union might be like in the 1980’s.I think my overall disappointment is the room and the lack of care or concern from Priceline. Agent I was in chat with named Caesar was indifferent who I just finished a chat with only exasperated me even more.The overall ratings here on TripAdvisor have been far more accurate. I’ll start here before I ever go back to Priceline. I would say paying more than $90 for this offering is totally offensive.Oh when we entered the room some of the lights didn’t work with the lampshade on the right side of the bed ripped and damaged.I reported this to the front desk and they seemed indifferent - I just didn’t want them to think I damaged one of the few things in the almost empty room.Sweet dreams and a lesson learned.

10-15 minutes walk distance from the Brooklyn Bridge, the World Trade Center and the Battery Park, the hotel building is a quite anonymous palace that was covered by a scaffolding at the time we visited it.Despite the appearance, the hotel was nice inside and our appartment was not so wide, but modern and cozy.The suite/ appartment was divided in three separeted areas: an equipped kitchen, a living room and the bedroom.There was no more than a 1-meter wide corridor all around the bed, however the room available in the living room was fine.There was no view since our room was just above the scaffolding.The bathroom was modern and equipped.The location is perfect to visit Manhattan: it takes around 30 minutes to get to Times Square using the underground, that could be the fastest way to move in NYC in traffic hours. The staff was friendly but not very proactive.There was a computer and a printer at guests disposal, that might be useful to print out some last-minute documents for the journey.The price (around 190 USD per night), despite the promotional room rate, was high for the product offered and breakfast was not included. However, since in NYC everything is sensibly more expensive than the standard US prices, I would say that you're paying a competitive price for a good location. The overall score is not so exciting (it should be a 3-star hotel) but at least you can benefit from a warm space and a kitchen to enhance your sense of indipendence.

Stayed here for four nights and overall had a decent stay. The hotel feels more like a three star rather than a four, but the room was spacious which is great for NYC standards. The shower area is a little strange with glass only covering the front half leaving the second half open (Jolly Madison hotel in midtown has a similar shower setup). The room had a very spacious closet as well which came in handy. The staff at the hotel were always very friendly and accommodating. Depending on pricing to other four star hotels, I would stay here again.

We stayed in Dec for three nights with our family and had three rooms. I booked it via name your own price on Priceline looking for a 4 star hotel... this is not a 4 star. I’m guessing the reason it’s rated a 4 star on National sites is because of location and amenities, not the quality of the hotel. The Good; The rooms were very large and spacious for NYC. We had a small kitchen with a full size refrigerator which was convenient Location is Great Staff was friendly and helpfulGood value for the area The BadWrong Star rating! Should be a 3 star.Old decor and the finishes in the room needs to be updated Only a half of shower door (odd) No bell staff to help with Luggage Beds were very hard and not comfortable

Nice location and rooms, it was a very clean and professional place. I’ll definitely be back to enjoy the quiet nights. There are some nice restaurants and bars near by that fit the setting. All of those pros for a reasonable price.

This is definitely NOT a 4,3, or 2 star hotel. The room has been renovated, however my grandchild would have been a better carpenter and painter. Extremely cheap materials used. The caulk around the sink and the tiles in the bathroom was gloobed on. The living room had only one chair. A straight back chair. No pots or pans in the kitchen all very old appliances including the tv's. No movie chanels. No paper towels or tissues in the unit. Only one electrical outlet in the bedroom. No concierge. We were extremely disappointed in this place!

Great little hotel if you just staying one night. Budget friendly. Front desk is very helpful. Hotel felt like a studio apartment with a kitchen. Only downside the walls are thin. They are making upgrades to fix that problem. Right down the street from wall street.

I booked this hotel on priceline where it was rated a 4 star. To start, this is not a 4 star hotel. It is a 3.5 star at best, and more likely a 3. The building is worn, it looks like they've tried to update it but with cheap materials and poor workmanship. The maid forgot to do something every day I was there (4 nights) (ie no new shampoo left, coffee not refreshed, no new hand towels). There is a shortage of furniture in the room, no desk, chair or dresser so I was constantly looking for surfaces to put stuff on (ie my wallet). There's no gym in the hotel, or bar (see above why it's not a 4 star). The cleanliness of the building reminded me of something you'd find at a dated highway side hotel. The location however is great, I was there for meetings on Wall Street and could easily walk to the NYSE. The front desk staff where also super friendly and helpful and are really carrying more then their weight for this property. Overall management needs to decide what they want this to be, an economy driven hotel, or an actual 4 star.

The new hotel we had reserved didn't open on time and we were directed at this hotel 2 days prior to arrival. It's not bad but it's not good. There was no furniture whatsoever in our room. One bed, one side table and the microwave on top of the fridge. No chair, no table, nothing except the bed and the toilet to sit on. It is very well situated, it is clean, it was updated with cheap materials that are already showing wear but it was very silent at night. It all depends on your needs...

The room was OK, not sparkling clean but it was fine, as I was only there for one night. However, I woke up in the morning to take a shower, and brown water gushed out for 2-3 seconds before turning clear. Needless to say, I didn't shower that morning. The same thing happened with the bathroom sink, so I couldn't brush my teeth either! When I went to the front desk, the employee was polite but simply gave me the business card of his manager and told me to contact her, which I did. After 3 days and two emails later, I received a response that they would be refunding me $60 of what I paid (~$300), but that it would take a while since they work through an intermediary in doing refunds.If you're in the area, find another hotel.

LOVED this place! Visited 9/7-9/11/17Corey and the rest of the staff made my 3 friends and I feel right at home and attended to our every need! Can't say enough good things about the place.... the room was huge and the loved the bed, hope to stay there again!

Location: my fault, I hadn't been to NY before, therefore I thought that the hotel was in the city centre, which is not. Result when travelling with a kid: a lot of money spent on taxis.Rooms: my room was fine, but my sister had booked a family room for 4 and her children had to sleep on a small leather sofa bed with just one sheet to cover it, so it was really uncomfortable. Service: really poor. We had to call for everything, nothing was ever anticipated. The reception staff seemed surprised when we asked to prepare the sofa bed for the children, we were supposed to do it ourselves. Rooms were tidied very late, or just after we complained to find them still dirty when coming back for a shower in the afternoon. The reception desk was unbelievable: you could see people relaxing in the back office; even if they saw you waiting for somebody to assist, nobody bothered to move. The worst was when I was trying to get a taxi back to the airport. I thought that in a city like NY this would have been easy, while it took me about an hour just to arrange this with the hotel. The staff was clearly trying to fool me calling the most expensive private car and I had to insist a lot to have a transfer at a reasonable price and I finally got it. If I had not spoken a good English I would have been duped. Breakfast: incredibly poor, there was almost nothing to eat. It is not expensive, but I would have preferred to pay more and eat something. You can have (if you are lucky) some nutella, some bread, 1 type of fruit, tea and coffee. That's it. The only good point was the guy serving there, who was helpful and very kind.I think the hotel is part of a Spanish group, so don't take English for granted here...

Quite a nice hotel. Helpful receptionists, and clean rooms. The beds were comfortable and the hotel is well situated for the Wall street subway and also the water taxis. It is a 5 minute walk from the Staten Island ferry.It is not a bad location for getting transport to all of the usual tourist stuff and well away from Times Square which is the armpit of the world.

When I reserved, I selected the "Business Avantages" plan to add on to my stay at USD 20. According to the website, this plan includes breakfast. Yet when I checked in, the front desk staff told me that breakfast was not included in my stay. I ended up paying USD 12 on each of the three days I had breakfast. Nor was I offered a courtesy bottle of water, hot drink and bathrobe that the plan supposedly includes.Very disappointed that I was scammed out of what I paid for.

While the lobby is very nice (and sets a nice expectation) and front desk staff is lovely, I would not recommend this hotel under any circumstances. The rooms are sparsely decorated, NO furnishings for your belongings at all - other than shelving in the closet (and in my room, had peeling paint on them.) The floor looked nice and shiny - but GREASY! I had to wear shoes the entire time. So gross. Water damage to bathroom vanity was disgusting -- swollen wood, ill-fitting cabinetry and mold!! and try as they might to keep the place clean (which was encouraging) -- the room had the strongest oder of cleanser you can imagine. I had to open the windows! I couldn't complete my stay - barely made it through one night and had to move. Mind you, I'm no prima donna, but this just wasn't worth the $$. Moved and found a lovely alternative for just a few bucks more per night.

The Eurostars Hotel Wall Street is probably the worse hotel I have ever stayed inthe room was dingy and felt unclean. The deadbolt on the door was broken The hotel looks and feel run downthe furnishings are old, ugly, and uncomfortable The bed is very smallAnd the front desk staff are rudeIt is not even a one out if ten rating

I came here on the night of July 6 from a vacation from Jamaica came almost around 10pm. The lady at desk gave me room 803 we walk in and there's only one king bed the thing is I have me my boyfriend and two kids. So I go downstairs and ask the front manager now a guy if I can have extra blankets and two pillows to make a pallet for my kids . He quickly said no I'll change you room with a pullout sofa ... in 2 minutes I switched rooms wayyyyy better now (407) my kids don't have to sleep on the floor. When you come here don't expect luxury if you want that go else where and pay higher probably a lot higher too! For 4 night I paid $600 can't beat that for Manhattan. The location is 10 minutes from 9/11...2 minute walk you can see the Brooklyn bridge and Mahayana bridge and the Statue of Liberty is max 15 minutes walk. Great location if you walk (very safe) several shops and food places every corner you turn. Definitely a great bang for your buck. Never had a noise problem , the bed is comfy and the rooms are very spacious for New York. If I'm ever on a budget and come back I'd come back. I have had nothing but a great experience!!!

This NYC trip is an annual get together I take with several professional women in order to participate in the Coney Island Mermaid parade (the largest arts parade in the US) I pre-booked 2 rooms for 3 nights that advertised 2 beds and a pull out sofa in each room. I called ahead 2 weeks prior and confirmed that these accommodations were correct and available. It would be remiss to recommend this hotel for the following reasons. 1.Six women arrived at the hotel with at least 2 bags each no one was there to open the door for us or offer assistance as we clearly struggled to walk up the entrance stairs with our luggage. 2. The clerk at the front desk and the manager then proceeded to eye us up and down as if we were in the wrong place. 3. One pull out bed did not work and the Manager was hostel and threatening in the process of correcting this problem. She wanted to refund our reservation and send us to another hotel.4. The manager referred to us as looking "sketchy."5. The manager blamed miscommunication on her non-English speaking international staff. 6. The manager called my room to continue an argument with me and suggest we leave the hotel. The location of this hotel is perfect for our itinerary and the rooms were clean however after being verbally accosted by the manager of the hotel I felt extremely uncomfortable trusting that my personal belongings would be safe and private including my credit card information. The way that my travel group was profiled was unprofessional and unexceptionable.

Great location, comfortable beds, friendly staff. But I had a problem trying to sleep because it was too noisy, probably because of the thin walls too. I wouldn't recommend this place to families with children or if you're planning a business trip. Everything else was nice though

I arrived at Eurostars Wall Street at 9:30pm after a business dinner only to find they'd given away my room! They were happy enough to refund the deposit, but it was quite difficult to find another hotel that late at night in Manhattan.I strongly recommend against selecting this hotel.

This is our second time staying here in 2 years. My daughter attends college at Pace university and it is a 5 min walk to the college. It is a great location for touring the financial district, Wall Street, Brooklyn bridge, seaport, & about 12 minute walk to 911 memorial. The hotel is so spacious for a New York hotel that its worth it if you are staying a few days.

This is the Best hotel that I stayed at in New York. The hotel staff was more than excellent, especially Daquan, the night front desk clerk. The hotel should be proud to have an employee like him. The room was extra large and exceptionally clean. If only I could find this hotel every time I'm in New York

Hotel is located nicely between Wall Street and seaport, Only a couple of minutes walk from beautiful views of the Brooklyn bridge, and the newly developed seaport shopping area. You can easily reach the world trade centre and subway stations lots of amenities on the door step. The hotel itself is clean and tidy with helpful staff. And it's a nice tranquil get away from all the hustle and bustle

Stephen P
Newcastle, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Pros:- Great price- Quiet neighborhood- 5 mins walk from nearest subway station- Tip: Twin Queen room is spacious !Cons:- Aging building- Expect some old / aging furniture in the room (my room safe is not working)- Room card access is always faulty, need constant changing at the counter

Picked this hotel because it was a) affordable. b) close to where we wanted to go in NYC; and c) could accommodate our friends who are a family of 5. Lobby clean. Front desk staff, nice and knowledgable. Lobby restrooms clean. Now the rooms....the elevator is a little rough looking from usage. The hallways are painted a dark brown, which is not a good choice for interior walls. No carpeting to lighten it up. Our room, 503, was directly across from the elevator but whether we were lucky or what we never heard a peep from the hallway. The rooms are in great need of renovation. The Pergo like flooring of our room was lifting at the corners. The queen bed had a headboard for a king. Only two pillows, no extra blankets. Only one bath towel in the bathroom. The vanity is begging to be replaced. The sink plumbing is reversed with hot on the right and cold on the left. Toilet is eco friendly and the walls are tiled so those are the thumbs up. The luggage stand is broken and tilts precariously. There are holes in the wall from some a holder or something that needs to be patched and repainted. There is no other chair in the room other than at the desk in the room so if one wants to read it is either on the bed, in the desk chair or on the floor. I understand this hotel is busy but they won't be seeing quality guests if they do not put some time and money into getting this hotel fixed. The flag out front of the hotel needs to be replaced as it is faded and doesn't represent the hotel well at all. Oh, the plus is the parking fee is paid at the hotel if using the Quick Park they recommend. It was $40/night and we thought that was quite reasonable.

The rooms were clean, but uncomfortable, the furniture was cheap when it was bought 30 years ago, and the facilities were pathetic. The wifi was next to non-existent, totally inadequate for the modern traveller. Breakfast looked like it was set out on the sunday, and had not changed since. The food itself was dreadful. I was in NY for a week, and heartily complained about this hotel at every opportunity. The worst thing is that the photograph of the room was clearly not of a typical room. Truth in advertising seems to be a problem for them.

Really liked the staff and the location. The rooms were big, however you could not take your shoes off, nor did you want to stay in the bathroom very long!! Great location, probably would not stay again!

Let's begin with the bed. I give it 5 stars. So very comfortable. But that's where it ends. The bed earned the one star. Bathroom vanity cabinet door falling off. No soap in bathroom. Light bulbs are out. Blow dryer is missing. Outlets in bathroom don't work. Room has a serious down hill slope to it. Coffee maker makes the weakest coffee I have ever seen, and that's even when I used 6 times as much coffee as I was supposed to use. I changed rooms and the next room reeked of cigarette smoke. Broken artwork hanging on walls. This place is in shambles. Avoid it. Doubletree down the road we the same price and it's not a dive.

Room was awful; room looked like it was in a war zone. I’ve never stayed in such a bad place. Floor was pealing, walls were chipped, I could go on and on about the gross room. Also the hotel charged me for an extra night when they said they wouldn’t. I’d never stay again.

New York City, New York

review_body: I believe this was once, and could again be, great. However, the glory days are long gone. The furniture and fixtures were of a high quality when installed. However, they have not been maintained and the hotel has lost its luster. Our room had broken bathroom fixtures and loose plumbing - (see previously posted pictures in this forum). The room had recessed lighting with dead bulbs. The laminate flooring was peeling up. The television was not working correctly.This was once, clearly, a great hotel. It is time for an overhaul to bring it back again. When I begin reading reviews about renovations , I will put it back on my list as it has a great location and, if fixed up, will be great.

OK so don't expect the city's most spotless , well decorated hotel, it really does need a bit of a refit but what do you expect for the price.BUT what I got was .....my own mini apartment with TV sofa, heater, a kitchen with coffee making facilities , good sized bathroom and a fantastically comfy bed.Someone review the staff as unfriendly???? No way Jose. On arrival reception was brilliant, so fast and friendly I was in my room within 5 minutes (thanks Jayson) plus the other dudes always said "hey morning sir how you doing" or something like that......No restaurants nearby???? Someone needs to check their guide book. Mad Dog and Beans is an awesome Mexican close by, Harry's is an incredible cocktail lounge, Josephs a great Italian. Sure it's 30 mins by subway into mid town but get over it, live like a New Yorker.....live a little......no.....live a lotSee you on next months trip

We wanted a little nicer room for our last two nights in New York. We came to the hotel late at night, and they where great welcoming us. The room was big! Very big for New York standar. It had a bedroom, big living room, kitchen and bathroom. But the bedroom was rather dirty, it was loose screws and what not, and we tolled them, and they gave us a partly refund, witch was nice.

stayed here for walking distance to Chinatown, Battery Park and 9/11 Memorial. The hotel was very quiet and very little street noise like Times square/Penn station areas. We walked to battery park to see statue of liberty, walked to 9/11 memorial, walked to Chinatown all less than 1 mile. Subway was 5 minute walk. Gregorys coffee and Starbucks within a block. The only downside was the continental breakfast it was below average which would have made this a perfect stay.

This hotel was not convenient to anything . . No restaurants were nearby except for a few lunch type places . The staff was very bad . Said they could not call me a taxi or help find me a restaurant . I ended up ordering pizza and a salad and the pizza was cold upon arrival ! The room was bad as the lamps were falling out of the wallAnd the bulbs burnt out ..

Clean safe hotel located close to the south street seaport area. Suite was equipped to sleep four with king bed in separate bedroom with a foldout futon style double sofa in living area. Small galley kitchen. Bathroom was clean but the vanity with the vessel style sink was in need of replacement. Overall a good value. Staff was friendly.

Just got back from a 3 night stay. The room was spacious and clean and the beds and pillows were comfy. Sure the floors were a little worn but for the price, who cares. We loved the location, it is on a nice quiet street with walking distance to transportation, restaurants, bars and entertainment. If I had to find one fault it was that our tv remote didn't work but we never told the front desk - I'm sure they would have fixed it if we had. All of the staff that we met were really friendly and helpful. We would definitely come back and recommend to others.

This is the only hotel in NYC that requires that you allow them to make copies of your drivers license or passport. These copies are stored in an unsecured manner. This is the leading cause of identity theft. The hotel staff were unpleasant and felt the threat of a night alone on the mean streets of NYC would be their lever. I opted instead for a nearby hotel where the staff was friendly and helpful, and of course did not require that I allow them to make copies of my identity documents. I am now fighting with the hotel to get a refund.

A worn hotel at a very good location for the business traveler in lower Manhattan. Spacious room with minimal but functional furnishing. I had an ironing board but no iron, which was quickly fixed by the friendly hotel staff. The inroom coffee machine did not work but there are plenty of cafes nearby.I will probably not return but it was a cost effective choice this time.

I would give it 0 stars if I could. We booked for 3 nights. When we checked in there was an exterminator in the room we were sent to, and the heating machine was disassembled all around the room. 5 minutes later the front desk man came and moved us to another room. In both rooms we saw three bathroom vanity was falling apart, the kitchen floor was in shambles, and all of the trim around the room was crumbling. Everything in the room felt dirty. BCThe front desk was incredibly unhelpful - we ended up leaving after one night. Would never recommend to anyone.

Hotel wants to be a four star, but misses on the details. Staff lacks attention to welcoming customer service. No personality or helpfulness. Bed is fine. Room was good size. But certain things in the room were rundown. The worst was the bathroom vanity. I would expect that in a one star. It made me question the cleanliness of everything. Then I found a bug - flying one so not super scary. Just not great experience. I saved $80 a night over the nearby Sheraton, but still...

This was a business trip to Manhattan financial district and after many experiences in tiny hotel rooms I must say I was pleasantly surprised. Especially when they upgraded us to a suite. Very spacious, clean and comfortable. Concierge was very helpful. I will go back. On a slight negative the tea jar in the lobby had some mold (fixed as soon as I mentioned it). All in all great experience.

Eurostars Wall Street is located just off the South end of Wall Street, sandwiched between a group of skyscrapers that dwarf the older building. Arriving in the morning we weren't able to check-in till the afternoon (usual) but the hotel staff were quite standoffish about it, let us leave our bags there but seemingly unwillingly. The hotel itself is very quite, not sure how full it was but didn't see more than a handful of people around at all (it is a smaller hotel, especially compared to some in NYC).The room was huge, with more space than we knew what to do with. Fridge/freezer and microwave included in the standard room. Air-con and wifi too. The room had a few faults though, very scant and unthoughtful decor, poor use of space and some water damage in the bath room gave the room an uncomfortable feeling. The bed was large and very comfortable so for a short stay (1-2 nights) perfect. However it would be a very difficult room to get settled in and for a longer stay it might be worth looking into somewhere with a little more character, even if it meant sacrificing the large room space.The morning was made strange by the lack of sunlight, due to the high-rise surrounding the hotel, a common problem in NYC but without the central location or interesting sights this made the hotel feel isolated rather than in the thick of the action as you might feel further uptown.

+ The room is ok and the bed is fine.- Noisy Refrigerator- Noisy Air Conditioning, I was not able to figure out how to switch off the fan - - THey charged me US$ 10 for one bottel of Perrier. For me more than enough reason not to go there nay more. That's a rip off.

Overall it is a nice hotel for downtown NY. I had room 804. Top floor, spacious. My coworker had a corner room which she did not like for the lack of space. My room was spacious and comfortable. They forgot to clean the coffeemaker everyday, but other than that it is nice and clean. Marble bathrooms.Front desk personnel and bartender are very dedicated to service which is what gives this place a plus. The only con I have to point is no ice machines. Yo have to go to the front desk to ask for ice and it is not handy. Need to improve on that. At least one good ice machine where the guests cam serve themselves.

This was our 10th trip to the city. I'm a bit of a hotel snob, so when we risked using Hotwire to save money I was a little nervous when we were assigned this hotel. The hotel itself: Excellent location, Small, Quiet, Lobby is decent, hallways are outdated, warm and a little smelly. The room: Spacious, if you like an extremely rock hard firm mattress then you'll love the bed (I did not), nice sized closet with safe, room had a refrigerator and microwave. The Bathroom: Ew. The vanity was decomposing from the moisture in the room, there were signs of mold in the bathroom and some places that were just not clean, it needed a good scrubbing. You get what you pay for proves true here. It's not a dump. It feels safe. But it is NOT a 4 star hotel... Oh and I must compliment employee Jayson who went out of his way upon check-in to answer some navigational questions I had, he was extremely nice and helpful! Also, I left a note on our bed asking for additional pillows and was happy to find that room service had honored that request upon our return.

Rooms are comfortable and up to date. The outside appearance is older but when you walk through the doors you don't even realize it's an older building. Great price and wonderful location close to the Staten Island Ferry and other things along the river. Only a few blocks from the metro making it easy to get around.

We had a great time with our friends. The service is very good. The staff is very welcoming.You are really closed to wall street, financial district.If it is your first time in N.Y., it can ve very practical. The pear is 10min walk.

Nice hotel at a great location downtown.Big rooms, although dark as windows are small.Wifi service was relatively fast for a NYC hotel.Good service at reception desk.Nice bath.If you need a financial district hotel, that's a good option. Also very close to plenty of dining and coffee options.

I can honestly say that I have never had a really bad stay at a hotel, until now! There was two men banging on my door around 10:30 at night. They woke up my children and scared my wife. I did not open the door. After about 15-20 minutes of banging on my door and the door of the room next to me, it stopped. Moments later my phone rang. The man on the other end threatened to kill my family and I after I had informed him that he had the wrong room. I called the hotel staff and they had a nonchalant attitude and seemed like they didn't care about what just took place. They said something along the lines of "they must have the wrong room." I was appalled to think that this type of behavior is acceptable. Needless to say, we checked out around 11pm. We have been requesting to speak to a manager in regards to a refund. Their customer service skills are the worst. This hotel's security protocols are nonexistent! The location is ideal, but all of the nonsense is not with the risk! Book at your own risk!!!

I booked this hotel at the last minute for business. The room was small, but that is somewhat expected for New York, especially at this price. What was unusual were the hard wood floors (noisy) and lack of furniture. It's Wall Street - expect people to be working and provide a desk, please. The overall impression was that of a cloister.The people were nice enough, the location was perfect, and the room seemed clean. For a short stay, I would go there again. For a longer stay, I'll look for someplace that I can work.

I booked this hotel for a Black Friday shopping trip in November 2015 with a friend. The location is absolutely perfect. It is close to the Hudson River and a 10 minute walk into SoHo. The room was very spacious and very clean. The staff were extremely friendly and always wanted to help us. I try to visit NYC every year and I will definitely be booking this hotel next time.

Yes the room is large, yes it is very well located, yes it is reasonably quiet, and importantly, yes the bed is comfortable. But no, I didn't like to find hairs in the toilets and the sofa half dismantled when I arrive. Neither I find acceptable to have such dirty floors in the corridors and pizza boxes put out of their room during the night by clients not yet removed at 10am. All this is showing a lack of seriousness in the cleaning.And no, the marks and darks spots on the walls and doors everywhere or the damaged bathroom cabinet are showing bad maintenance not at par with a so-called 4-stars hotel.I won't come back.

My company booked this hotel and I never gave it a second thought thinking it must be decent if near Wall St. How wrong I was. Initially given room 408 which was very claustrophobic as no natural light looking out onto brick walls. Rang reception and was moved. I was given room looking onto street but still a bit miserable. Wooden floor needed care and attention, lots of marks on the walls and the general decor was very down at heel. The bathroom was a festering dump and the towels were very off white which to my mind should have been thrown out months ago (see picture). I just got the sense that this hotel is a cash cow for its owner and no money spent on up keep. Also Aircon was noisy. I will not be returning.

The location is great, it is a 5min walk from the wall street subway station and the subway would take you to pretty much everywhere you want to go. The brooklyn bridge is also within walking distance. The downside is it is a pretty small hotel, so it is a bit short of staff, but the staff were very friendly and helpful.

The room was larger than I expect for a New York hotel, but not particularly nice. Good price for the area, definitely worth checking out the brooklyn bridge if t he weather is nice and you have some free time.

The building shows its age, especially in the area of fittings. But I was astounded by the size of the room - two double beds, sofa, desk and an area suitable for a good workout - at least double the size of most New York hotel rooms. Clean, comfortable, no in-house dining other than breakfast, no bar facilities. My first choice in this area of New York was full, Eurostars is an acceptable fallback for a couple of nights.

Love the apartment style room. Very homey without the housekeeping and now has room service! Super location for all my needs for duration of trip! Marta and her staff all fantastic!! Will book every time we return to NY.

The hotel lobby and rooms are really nice. The staff is really cool and accommodating. The hallway on the floor I stayed on however was somewhat smelly (like old cigarettes) and looked old which was completely contrary to how the lobby and rooms looked and smelled. The room smelled fresh and airy. Despite the hallway I would still stay here again. Be warned that they do not have ice machines in the building but there was a refrigerator in the room. The bathrooms were cool and the shower was great however there is no shower curtain so water can splash quite a bit.

I had a meeting in the financial district at 6:30am, so this hotel was within walking distance to my appointment. My check-in was later in the evening, and the front desk clerk and another associate were pleasant and professional. The room was impeccably clean. The bed was very comfortable.Three pillowcases were needed, and the attendant delivered them quickly and apologized. No wash-rags were in the bathroom, but two bath towels and two hand towels were there. Door and cabinetry were older, but in good working order. Floor is a wood laminate. Lighting from high ceiling was very bright. Closet was a generous size with an in-room safe. Television was wall mounted. Microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker in room. Space available for a side chair, but there was not one there.New York City is very noisy, so the extreme quiet at this hotel was much appreciated. I would stay here again.

They state they have cable but basic cable is all we got. All of 13 channels maybe I guess tbs was the cable channel. When asked about it was told the maintenance man would be in at 11 pm. Called & by this time went downstairs was told again "we definitely have cable television". Non English speaking maintenance man came, changed the channels & said yeah that's "all channels, in every room same channel in the morning engineer coming he no more than me". Whaaaaaaa?! Ok whatever. Brown stain greets you as soon as you open the bathroom door. Half a shower window allows for all the water to be on the floor.

We went here for Valentines Day and absolutely loved it. We booked online for a king bed room but was offered a free upgrade when we got there. We were given a suit instead, fully equipped with a kitchen, separate living area and a nice bathroom. There is free wifi in the hotel, but being in NYC we expected it. The one thing that confused me was the mini bar (fridge with drinks/candy). We were not given any information about it so we were not sure if its paid for already or not so we did not take any.

This was my first time staying in this area of Manhattan, I'm a regular to the city, I was travelling solo having flown in from Mexico after a weeks holiday with my boyfriend, he flew onto Vegas.At check in I was told I had been upgraded to a suite, I double checked I wasn't getting charged for this! I had an entire one bedroom apartment to myself. A fully fitted kitchen, nice sized living room and a bathroom with a bath. You could see the Empire State Building through the window. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the wifi was free and there was a laptop downstairs you could use for free (I needed to print my ticket for One World Trade). The hotel was in a great location, a stones through away from the Hudson. There was a Starbucks on the corner, the closest subway was Wall Street, which was only a few blocks away and you could walk to Ground Zero via Century 21 and also South Street Seaport, which at the time was closed for renovation.I only stayed for 3 nights but would definitely stay again.

This hotel has given up. It's not a bad hotel, its in a very convenient location, and the staff is pretty nice. But make no mistake, this hotel is no longer investing in fixing their hotel, or keeping it in great shape. It shows a lot of wear, and the rooms feel used. There are loud air conditioners (really loud), dirty walls, scraped and beaten floors, warping cabinets, poorly maintained fixtures. Look, it's fine. It's a 2 star hotel in a 4 star location, but a 4 star hotel it ain't. The rooms are big. But so is a 1960s Winnebago.

I was surprised and delighted by this little hotel. My son attends a nearby college, and I am so happy to have found a great place to visit in the FiDi. Pros: - For me, location. If you want to be in the Financial District, this is a nice choice. One block from the East River. Just 3-4 minute walk from the subway. - It's really really clean. I am a little neurotic about this kind of thing, and I took apart the bedding to check for anything unmentionable. The bedding, mattress, and mattress cover looked very new. My room had flooring, not carpet, so there was no "musty smell" as I've seen in other reviews. The restaurant area was also extremely clean. - Lobby has a small but comfy sitting area.- We were upgraded to a small suite. Sweet! - Our views were of busy Wall Street area hustle & bustle. Very pleasant to look out on all the NYC hubbub.- Price was quite reasonable.- Suite included small living room and full (small) equipped kitchen.Cons:- Furnishing seemed quite spartan in the living room area of the suite. However, since the upgrade to suite was free, I am not complaining!! Just a heads-up to future guests.- Front Street is not a lovely block. You just need to know this and not expect a picturesque street. It's more convenient than attractive. However the river walk area, one block away, is quite nice for a stroll.I would stay here again. For me, wanting a FiDi location, it's a great choice. Travelers need to be aware that this hotel is ALL THE WAY AT THE SOUTHERN TIP of Manhattan, and is not in Midtown or other touristy areas.

This hotel happens to be very close to work, and is a convenient place to stay. Prices are incredibly good during winter, which is usually when I need to stay locally. There are some restaurants very close by, and the location is safe and quiet. The staff is nice enough, and will occasionally upgrade you to a bigger room. The rooms are clean but do smell of cleaning supplies when you first walk in. The rooms have very basic amenities and free wifi.

I want to start by saying that the staff was amazing! However, the hotel can use some work. We rented the one bedroom suite with a kitchen. The room was huge (by New York standards), wood floors, full kitchen and nice views. The first night I found hair on the bed, i called downstairs and after a long time they sent up the maintenance man to bring sheets. There was no housekeeping staff so we had to change the sheets ourselves. We also asked for extra pillows which came up 2 days later. There is no room service and no onsite restaurant ( it will open next month). They do serve breakfast until 10 a.m. The towels are pretty bad and there are stains on the floor. I would also recommend bringing your own shampoo, conditioner and soap as these were not replenished daily. The really odd thing that happened on the last night there was: we went to walk to a little market nearby and there were like 50 used condoms on the side of the building -_-. We were traveling with my 16 year old so that was a little awkward to explain. On the other hand, as i mentioned before the staff was great!. very helpful extremely nice. Anthony and his staff answered all of our questions and were very apologetic about the sheet situation. There's a market a few blocks down ( i think it's called Fulton market) they deliver your groceries. Which was great because we were there 8 days.

Hotel has a musty stuff smell, probably coming from a large stain in the carpet. As you walk down the hallway you get the sense of being in a college dorm.. Here's the list of things that just don't make sense for any hotel!!!!!!!!- banged up and scratched doors-closet door handle broken and hanging through broken wood- large scratches in the drywall in the room- sparsely decorated room- broken shower head- broken bathroom faucet- dirty bathroom floor- no place to hang clothes or extra towels in the bathroom- a business center that consists of a folding table, laptop and printer, but the speed is very slow on the laptop and you can't print to the printer. I had to email my documents to the hotel who then printed them off for me- flat screen TV that isn't high-definition, how is that possible for any quality hotel- remote to the TV didn't work and had to be replaced I would NOT recommend that hotel to anyone!!!!!! Find another hotel.

No frills here. The lobby is pretty basic and there is minimal staff around. They are helpful and friendly, but don't expect a particularly warm atmosphere full of service. The elevator and hallways feel a bit dated and worn out. The room itself is very minimal, and not in a particularly understated elegant way but just in terms of furnishings it feels a little incomplete. It is spacious though on the upside. The hardwood floors were clean but the room itself didn't feel very cool or warm.The bathroom is nice, clean and modern.For the price, it's a decent value but don't expect anything amazing here or a terrific bargain.

I paid £104 for a night here, I paid for a standard but I had a complimentary upgrade to a suite. It was a nice room with a big TV, comfy bed and sofa. The room was clean but it needed something extra some pictures and a coat of paint would do it wonders. Also the tap in the bathroom felt like it was going to fall out. It was a quiet area away, a bit tricky to find. After walking for a bit I called an Uber taxi - much easier! Breakfast is $10 served on the bar with a decent selection of things. Some might think it looks small but everything you could want is there. The waiter James was lovely and very attentive. I enjoyed my stay and loved the 12pm check out, gave me time to chill out before my busy day.

I stayed at the hotel in late October. The cost of the room was $800 USD for three nights. For that price, even in NYC, I'd expect something better than a university dorm feel. No comfortable chair to sit in, no rugs or mat on the hardwood floor, fairly banged up walls and closet doors that didn't close properly. The staff were nice enough and the location is good but you can find much more charming options.

I virtually live in hotels. I called to see if i can get an early check in, the woman who answered the phone, I couldn't understand and apparently there was no one else there to speak with. Ok, I have a bad back, i was barked at, then i get to the hotel at the appoined time. I suggest that if someone doesn't speak clear enough English to answer the phone, perhaps someone else should be around. I checked out ontime, checked my bags, did my best to plaster a smile on my face, and now I'm the problem guest. The change in management over the past year at Eurostar has brought a lovely hotel to guest service to a hot sheet hotel. Congratulations, you lost a customer.

New York City, New York

review_body: We relied on reviews and photos when we booked our stay in Sept. We were actually a bit excited at first as I like to experience different hotel chains. However, contrary to the reviews we had read at the times, the hotel was in poor condition. We checked in quite late, went out at night, and were leaving really early the next day so we didn't experience much of the rest of the property. That few hours we had were more than enough for us. Only the lobby was okay, but the moment you stepped into the elevator and onto the corridors, it was definitely not a four star hotel. It was outdated with a heavy musty/moldy smell. The room itself was not clean and also falling apart. I agree with another reviewer that it looked like a beat up dorm room that had a quick fix up. The hotel room we stayed at had a weird layout. The room opened up to a small narrow hallway that lead up to the rest of the room.The leather couch in the living area had no support, we sank right in. The fake wooden vinyl floor was sticky and dirty. There were lints/hairballs so large and stuck under the room door. The handles/door looked like they were about to fall apart anytime, we were not quite sure if we could sleep safely at night. The bathroom faucet was wobbly and the cabinet was so badly water damaged that you could see all the pressed wood expanded from within. Overall the room was just not clean and not up to a four star hotel like it claims.We really didn't have to be observant for any of the above mentioned and we actually tried not to be so we wouldn't get more grossed out by it. The bed was comfortable at the very least. We had an early flight to catch the next day and although the staff was friendly, he greeted us in a t shirt and sweatpants as he came out from the back when we were checking out.

Even though the elevator and corridors were outdated, and the lobby was modern but small, we loved the spaciousness of the room. It is not like your ordinary squashy hotel room, it is on the 'trendy' side. We could easily place our shopping bags on the floor, next to both of our two large suitcases (that were open). The room we had came with a microwave and fridge. The rooms and bathroom were clean. The air-conditioner was also outdated. If you like lower Manhattan, it is a reasonably priced hotel. The staff were polite. If you need to buy anything it quite close to a pharmacy/convenience store (known as Duane Reade). This hotel is not for everyone, however it is a practical place to stay in overnight, if you are not staying in your room the whole day.We would go there again.

The place is in a good location and appears nice on the outside, but the place is really outdated on the inside and the rooms are falling apart. The carpet in the hallways is stained and nasty and the wallpaper is peeling away from the walls.The room was clean but the pergo floor was peeling and the bathroom fixture was falling apart and the shower head is situated for someone 4 ft tall!There is no outlet near the head of the bed so they stuck the phone and clock on a table at the foot of the bed, not very convenient. The bed was comfortable. That's about the best thing I can say for this place.Not worth the money!

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My boss and I stayed at this hotel during a business trip for a week. We had seen and read many positive reviews prior to our stay so once we arrived we were very disappointed by what we found. The room was not the cleanest and seemed very small for the price. Our bathroom linens remained on the floor after housekeeping left and they did not ever clean the bedding during our stay. We purchased the option which included their breakfast buffet. Breakfast was supposed to start at 7:00 am, but it was never ready when we went downstairs at 7:15. Thankfully, there is plenty to do in NYC to keep you busy and out of the hotel. I would never book here again.

The staff at this Eurostars hotel were exceptionally nice and responsive . . . and that's about the only nice thing I can say about our experience. Otherwise, it ranks as one of the worst hotel experiences ever. This is contrast to some other reviews but I can only say that for us it was so bad that we cancelled our second night and checked out the next morning. It was listed as a four star hotel on priceline so we felt comfortable booking it but what a mistake. The first impression in the lobby is actually pretty good, but as soon as you get off the elevator you know you've made a mistake. The hallway has a musty stuff smell, probably coming from a large stain in the carpet. As you walk down the hallway you get the sense of being in a college dorm, that's probably how I would describe it, a dressed up dorm. Here's the list of things that just don't make sense for any hotel, let alone one in Manhattan's financial district:- banged up and scratched doors-closet door handle broken and hanging through broken wood-peeling faux-wood flooring- large scratches in the drywall in the room- sparsely decorated room- broken shower head-shower head too low for someone who is more than six feet- broken bathroom faucet- dirty bathroom floor- no place to hang clothes or extra towels in the bathroom- a thermostat that cannot be set at below 68 degrees even though the room never cooled off to below 73 (and the only option offered by the hotel was to have a portable AC unit brought to the room, are you kidding?)- a business center that consists of a folding table, laptop and printer, but the speed is very slow on the laptop and you can't print to the printer. I had to email my documents to the hotel who then printed them off for me- the hotel bar was closed by 8:30- flat screen TV that isn't high-definition, how is that possible for any quality hotel- remote to the TV didn't work and had to be replacedAs I said at the beginning the staff were incredibly pleasant and willing to help wherever they could, but they can only do so much. I would avoid at all costs and find another hotel.

Our family spent a week at this boutique hotel and found it to be very nice and comfortable. Our room had 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The entire staff was friendly and always helpful assisting with restaurant recommendations, subway schedules, etc..The breakfasts were good. Special kudos to a young lady named Jasmine. It is refreshing to see someone with such passion and who takes pride in their job. Every morning, she welcomed us all with a smile and always made sure we were satisfied with our breakfast before we started our NY days! The location of the hotel is walking distance to the Staten Island Ferry, Brooklyn Bridge, Financial District, World Trade Center Memorial and subway stations.

Took our son to NYC to start college and needed a place for three people but only one day once he moved into dorm at New School. They were very gracious and upgraded our room to a suite with queen pull out sofa and full kitchen. A block away from Smorgasburg street dining and cocktails. Very nice and across the street from seaport

Nice, clean facility. Room a good size. Staff a bit "cold" but did their job, employees watched you closely upon entering &leaving hotel. Would stay there again. Close to Seaport, neighborhood restaurants.
